  "article_text": [
    "the production of tau - lepton pairs in high energy @xmath6 collisions has been used to set bounds on its electromagnetic and weak dipole moments @xcite . in the standard model ( sm )",
    "@xcite , the @xmath7 anomalous magnetic moment ( mm ) @xmath8 is predicted to be @xmath9 @xcite and the respective electric dipole moment ( edm ) @xmath10 is generated by the gim mechanism only at very high order in the coupling constant @xcite .",
    "similarly , the weak mm and edm are induced in the sm at the loop level giving @xmath11 @xcite and @xmath12 cm @xcite . since the current bounds on these dipole moments @xcite are well above the sm predictions , it has been pointed out that these quantities are excellent candidates to look for physics beyond the sm @xcite .",
    "the couplings of the photon and @xmath13 gauge boson to charged leptons may be parameterized in the following form :    @xmath14    where @xmath15 , @xmath16 is the lepton mass and @xmath17 is the momentum transfer .",
    "the @xmath18-dependent form - factors @xmath19 have familiar interpretations for @xmath20 : @xmath21 is the electric charge ; @xmath22 ; and @xmath23 .",
    "the weak dipole moments are defined in a similar way : @xmath24 and @xmath25 . the measurement of @xmath26 and @xmath27 has been done in the @xmath28 decay mode at lep .",
    "the latest bounds obtained for the electromagnetic and weak dipole moments from the delphi and aleph collaborations at the 95@xmath29 c.l .",
    "are : @xmath30 , @xmath31 and @xmath32 , @xmath33 @xcite .",
    "the first limits on the mm and edm of the @xmath7 lepton were obtained by grifols and mndez using l3 data @xcite : @xmath34 and @xmath35 cm .",
    "escribano and mass @xcite later used electroweak precision measurements to get @xmath36 cm and @xmath37 at the @xmath38 confidence level .",
    "there is extensive theoretical work done in models beyond the sm that contribute to edm of charged leptons . in ref .",
    "@xcite , the edm of charged leptons are studied assuming that they have gaussian profiles in extra dimensions . in @xcite",
    "the lepton edm has been analyzed in the framework of the seesaw model .",
    "the electric dipole moments of the leptons in the version iii of the 2hdm are considered in @xcite .",
    "the work @xcite was related to the lepton edm in the framework of the sm with the inclusion of non - commutative geometry .",
    "furthermore , the effects of non - universal extra dimensions on the edm of fermions in the two higgs doublet model have been estimated in ref .",
    "@xcite . in @xcite , limits on the electromagnetic and weak dipole moments of the tau - lepton in the framework of a left - right symmetric model ( lrsm ) and a class of @xmath39 inspired models with an additional neutral vector boson @xmath40 have been analyzed .",
    "theoretically , numerous new physics models are proposed with different roles of higgs in the models .",
    "the little higgs model ( lhm ) @xcite has been proposed for solving the little hierarchy problem . in this scenario ,",
    "the higgs boson is regarded as a pseudo nambu - goldstone boson associated with a global symmetry at some higher scale .",
    "though the symmetry is not exact , its breaking is specially arranged to cancel quadratically divergent corrections to the higgs mass term at 1-loop level .",
    "this is called the little higgs mechanism . as a result",
    ", the scale of new physics can be as high as 10 @xmath4 without a fine - tuning on the higgs mass term . in these models , relatively light higgs boson mass is due to its identity as a pseudo goldstone boson of some enlarged global symmetries . among various little higgs models ,",
    "the simplest little higgs model ( slhm ) @xcite is attractive due to its relatively simple theory structure .",
    "detailed discussions on slhm can be found in the literature @xcite .    on the @xmath1 peak , where a large number of @xmath1 events are collected at @xmath41 colliders",
    ", one may hope to constrain or eventually measure the electromagnetic and weak dipole moments of the @xmath7 by selecting @xmath42 events accompanied by a hard photon .",
    "the feynman diagrams which give the most important contribution to the cross section from @xmath43 are shown in fig .",
    "the total cross section of @xmath44 will be evaluated at the @xmath1-pole in the framework of a simplest little higgs model .",
    "the numerical computation for the anomalous magnetic and the electric dipole moments of the tau is done using the data collected by the l3 and opal collaborations at lep @xcite .",
    "we are interested in studying the effects induced by the effective couplings associated to the weak and electromagnetic moments of the tau lepton given in eq .",
    "( 1 ) . for this purpose",
    ", we will take the respective anomalous vertices @xmath45 and @xmath46 , one at the time , in diagrams ( 1 ) and ( 2 ) of fig .",
    "the numerical computation for the respective transition amplitudes will be done using the data collected by these collaborations .",
    "our aim in this paper is to analyze the reaction @xmath44 in the @xmath1 boson resonance .",
    "the analysis is carried out in the context of a simplest little higgs model @xcite and we attribute electromagnetic and weak dipole moments to the tau lepton .",
    "processes measured in the resonance serve to set limits on the tau electromagnetic and weak dipole moments . first , using as an input the results obtained by the l3 and opal collaborations @xcite for the tau mm and edm in the process",
    "@xmath44 , we will set a limit on the slhm energy scale @xmath2 which is similar to that obtained through oblique corrections @xcite , as well as that obtained recently from the @xmath1 leptonic decay @xcite .",
    "we then use this limit on @xmath2 to get bounds on the weak dipole moments of the tau from the same l3/opal data .",
    "we have found that these limits are consistent with the new bounds obtained by the delphi and aleph collaborations from the process @xmath47 @xcite .",
    "this paper is organized as follows : in sect .",
    "ii we present the calculation of the cross section for the process @xmath44 in a simplest little higgs model . in sect .",
    "iii we present our results for the numerical computations and , finally , we present our conclusions in sect .",
    "in this section we calculate the total cross section for the reaction @xmath48 using the neutral current lagrangian given in eq .",
    "( 22 ) of ref .",
    "@xcite for the slhm for diagrams 1 and 2 of fig .",

    "the mm , edm and the characteristic energy scale of the simplest little higgs model @xmath2 give a contribution to the differential cross section for the process @xmath58 of the form :    @xmath59 [ \\frac{1 - 4x_w+8x^2_w}{x^2_w(1-x_w)^2}]\\nonumber\\\\ & & [ \\frac{(1 - 4x_w+x^2_w ) ( s-2\\sqrt{s}e_\\gamma)+\\frac{1}{2}e^2_\\gamma\\sin^2\\theta_\\gamma}{(s - m^2_{z_{1}})^2+m^2_{z_{1}}\\gamma^2_{z_{1}}}]\\nonumber\\\\ & & [ 1+\\frac{1}{8}\\frac{(3 - 4x_w)}{(1-x_w)^2}(\\frac{v^2}{f^2})]^4{e_\\gamma de_\\gamma d\\cos\\theta_\\gamma},\\end{aligned}\\ ] ]    where @xmath60 , @xmath61 is the vacuum expectation value and @xmath62 , @xmath63 are the energy and the opening angle of the emmited photon .",
    "it is useful to consider the smallness of the factor @xmath64 , to approximate the cross section in eq .",
    "( 4 ) by its expansion in powers of @xmath64 to the linear term : @xmath65 $ ] , where @xmath66 and @xmath67 are constants which can be evaluated .",
    "such an approximation for deriving the bounds of @xmath68 and @xmath10 is more illustrative and easier to manipulate .    for @xmath69",
    ", the total cross section for the process @xmath70 is given by    @xmath71,\\ ] ]    where @xmath66 explicitly is    @xmath72\\nonumber\\\\ & & [ \\frac{(1 - 4x_w+x^2_w ) ( s-2\\sqrt{s}e_\\gamma)+\\frac{1}{2}e^2_\\gamma\\sin^2\\theta_\\gamma}{(s - m^2_{z_{1}})^2+m^2_{z_{1}}\\gamma^2_{z_{1 } } } ] { e_\\gamma de_\\gamma d\\cos\\theta_\\gamma},\\nonumber\\\\\\end{aligned}\\ ] ]    while @xmath67 is given by    @xmath73\\nonumber\\\\ & & [ \\frac{(1 - 4x_w+x^2_w ) ( s-2\\sqrt{s}e_\\gamma)+\\frac{1}{2}e^2_\\gamma\\sin^2\\theta_\\gamma}{(s - m^2_{z_{1}})^2+m^2_{z_{1}}\\gamma^2_{z_{1}}}]\\nonumber\\\\ & & [ \\frac{(3 - 4x_w)}{(1-x_w)^2}(\\frac{v^2}{f^2})]{e_\\gamma de_\\gamma d\\cos\\theta_\\gamma}.\\end{aligned}\\ ] ]    the expression given for @xmath66 corresponds to the cross section previously reported by grifols and mndez for the sm @xcite , while @xmath67 comes from the contribution of the slhm .",
    "evaluating the limit when the characteristic energy scale @xmath74 , the second term in ( 5 ) is zero and eq .",
    "( 5 ) is reduced to the expression ( 4 ) given in ref .",
    "@xcite .    in the case of the weak dipole moments , to get the expression for the differential cross section , we have to substitute the @xmath1 slhm couplings given in eq .",
    "( 23 ) of ref .",
    "@xcite with the respective weak dipole moments included in eq .",
    "( 1 ) , that is to say @xmath75 and @xmath76 .",
    "we do not reproduce the analytical expressions here because they are rather similar to the term given in eq .",
    "( 4 ) . in the following section we will present the bounds obtained for the tau dipole moments using the data published by the l3 and opal collaborations for the reaction @xmath70 @xcite",
    "in practice , detector geometry imposes a cut on the photon polar angle with respect to the electron direction , and further cuts must be applied on the photon energy and minimum opening angle between the photon and tau in order to suppress background from tau decay products . in order to evaluate the integral of the total cross section as a function of the parameters of the slhm , that is to say , @xmath2",
    ", we require cuts on the photon angle and energy to avoid divergences when the integral is evaluated at the important intervals of each experiment . we integrate over @xmath77 from @xmath78 to @xmath79 and @xmath80 from 5 @xmath81 to 45.5 @xmath81 for various fixed values of the characteristic energy scale @xmath82 @xmath4 ( as illustrated in fig .",
    "2 ) according to refs . @xcite . using the numerical values @xmath83 , @xmath84 @xmath81 , @xmath85 @xmath81 and @xmath86 @xmath81",
    ", we obtain the cross section @xmath87 .    in fig .",
    "2 , we show the dependence of the total cross section for the process @xmath88 with respect to the slhm energy scale @xmath2 . using the data @xmath89 @xmath90 refs . @xcite for the cross section , where the first error is statistical and the second is systematic , we get the following limit for @xmath2 :    @xmath91    which is consistent with that obtained through oblique corrections @xcite , as well as that obtained recently from an analysis on the decay width @xmath92 @xcite .    as was discussed in ref .",
    "@xcite , @xmath93 , using poisson statistic @xcite , we require that @xmath94 be less than 1559 , with @xmath95 @xmath96 , according to the data reported by the l3 collaboration ref . @xcite and references therein . taking this into consideration",
    ", we can get a bound for the tau magnetic moment as a function of @xmath2 with @xmath97 .",
    "the values obtained for this bound for several values of @xmath2 are included in table 1 . the previous analysis and comments",
    "can readily be translated to the edm of the tau with @xmath98 .",
    "the resulting bounds for the edm as a function of @xmath2 are shown in table 1 .",
    "as expected , the limits obtained for the electromagnetic dipole moments of the tau lepton are consistent with those obtained by these collaborations from the data for the process @xmath88 @xcite .    [ cols=\"^,^,^\",options=\"header \" , ]     table 2 .",
    "bounds on the @xmath26 anomalous weak mm and @xmath27 weak edm of the @xmath7-lepton for different values of the characteristic energy scale of the model @xmath2 .",
    "we have applied the cuts used by l3 for the photon angle and energy .",
    "we plot the total cross section in fig .",
    "3 as a function of the characteristic energy scale of the model @xmath2 for the bounds of the magnetic moment given in table 1 . in fig .",
    "3 , for @xmath99 @xmath4 we reproduce the data previously reported in the literature . our results for the dependence of the differential cross section on the photon energy versus the cosine of the opening angle between the photon and the beam direction ( @xmath100 ) are presented in fig . 4 for @xmath101 @xmath4 and @xmath102 .",
    "besides we plot the differential cross section in fig . 5 as a function of the photon energy for the bounds of the magnetic moments given in table 1 .",
    "we observe in this figure that the energy distributions are consistent with those reported in the literature . finally , we find that the effects induced by the tree level @xmath103 and @xmath104 couplings in the slhm increase the cross section of the process @xmath105 , and the predictions on the electromagnetic and weak dipole moments of the tau lepton are better estimated",
    ". however , it is necessary to make an analysis at loop level for the process @xmath106 in the context of a little higgs model .",
    "we have determined limits on the electromagnetic and weak dipole moments of the tau - lepton using the data published by the l3 and opal collaborations for the @xmath88 at the @xmath1 pole .",
    "we were able to get limits on the weak dipole moments by constraining the slhm energy scale @xmath2 from the electromagnetic dipole moments obtained by these collaborations .",
    "we then used this limit to determined bounds on the electromagnetic and weak dipole moments of the tau lepton using the data published by the l3 and opal collaborations for the process @xmath0 .",
    "in addition , we obtained bounds for the weak dipole moments similar to those obtained recently by the delphi / aleph collaborations from the process @xmath47 @xcite .",
    "in particular , from the limit @xmath107 , our bound take the value previously reported in ref .",
    "@xcite for the sm",
    ". as far as the weak dipole moments are concerned , our limits given in tables 1 and 2 are consistent with the experimental bounds obtained at lep with the two - body decay mode @xmath28 @xcite .",
    "in addition , the analytical and numerical results for the total cross section have never been reported in the literature before and could be of relevance for the scientific community ."

  "abstract_text": [
    "<S> from the total cross section for the reaction @xmath0 at the @xmath1 pole and in the framework of a simplest little higgs model ( slhm ) , we get a limit on the characteristic energy scale of the model @xmath2 , @xmath3 @xmath4 , which in turn induces bounds on the electromagnetic and weak dipole moments of the tau - lepton . our bounds on the electromagnetic moments are consistent with the bounds obtained by the l3 and opal collaborations for the reaction @xmath0 . </S>",
    "<S> we also obtained bounds on the tau weak dipole moments which are consistent with the bounds obtained recently by the delphi and aleph collaborations from the reaction @xmath5 . </S>"
